result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 04-18-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree recklessly endanger safety, fleeing an officer, operate without owner's consent and obstruct officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-25-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Jessica N. Loney, DOB: 12-27-91.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.
